skill.name: entra-app-registration
skill.description: Guides Microsoft Entra ID app registration, OAuth 2.0 authentication, and MSAL integration.
skill.summary: Step-by-step guidance for Microsoft Entra ID app registration, OAuth 2.0 flows, and MSAL integration across multiple languages.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All 529 static findings are false positives. The skill is official Microsoft documentation for Entra ID app registration, OAuth 2.0 flows, and MSAL integration. Detected patterns (external_commands, network, filesystem, env_access) are legitimate documentation showing Azure CLI commands and Microsoft endpoint URLs.

dangerous_patterns.title: Documentation False Positives
dangerous_patterns.description: Static scanner flagged markdown documentation examples as security issues. Azure CLI commands (az ad app create), Microsoft URLs (login.microsoftonline.com, learn.microsoft.com), and OAuth terminology triggered false positive alerts.

content.value_statement: This skill provides step-by-step guidance for registering applications in Microsoft Entra ID, configuring OAuth 2.0 authentication flows, and integrating MSAL libraries across multiple programming languages.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through Microsoft Entra ID app registration process
Explain OAuth 2.0 authorization code, implicit, and client credentials flows
Provide Azure CLI commands for app registration and management
Show MSAL integration examples for .NET, Python, JavaScript, and Java
Configure API permissions and scopes for Microsoft Graph
Troubleshoot common authentication errors and token issues
limitations: Does not cover Azure RBAC role assignments (use azure-rbac skill)
Does not handle Key Vault secret management (use azure-keyvault skill)
Does not provide Azure resource security configuration
Does not include Bicep/ARM template deployment for non-Entra resources

use_cases.title: First-time app registration
use_cases.description: Walk developers through registering their first application in Microsoft Entra ID, including choosing app type, configuring redirect URIs, and setting up authentication.

use_cases.title: Console app authentication
use_cases.description: Help developers add user authentication to console applications using MSAL libraries with interactive login flows.
use_cases.target_user: .NET, Python, or Node.js developers building CLI tools

use_cases.title: Service-to-service authentication
use_cases.description: Guide implementation of daemon or service authentication using client credentials flow for background jobs and APIs.

output_examples.input: Create an app registration for a web app using Azure CLI
Add Microsoft Graph permissions to existing app

best_practices: Use certificates instead of client secrets for production web apps
Request only the minimum API permissions needed (least privilege)
Use managed identities for Azure-hosted apps to avoid storing secrets
Configure token lifetime policies to balance security and user experience
anti_patterns: Hardcoding client secrets in source code or configuration files
Using implicit flow for confidential clients (use authorization code flow instead)
Requesting excessive permissions that the app does not need
Skipping token validation in production applications

faq.question: What is the difference between app registration and enterprise application?
faq.answer: App registration creates the app definition in your tenant. Enterprise application is the service principal instance that represents the app in each tenant where it is used.

faq.question: When should I use client secrets vs certificates?
faq.answer: Use certificates for production environments as they are more secure. Client secrets are simpler for development but should be rotated frequently.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the tenant ID?
faq.answer: The tenant ID identifies the Azure AD organization (directory) where the app is registered. It is required for authentication requests.

faq.question: How do I implement single sign-on (SSO)?
faq.answer: Register your app in Microsoft Entra ID and configure it to use the same authentication endpoint. Users who are already signed in to Entra will authenticate automatically.

faq.question: What is MSAL and why should I use it?
faq.answer: MSAL (Microsoft Authentication Library) is the recommended library for integrating with Microsoft identity platform. It handles token caching, refresh, and renewal automatically.

faq.question: How do I get the application ID after registration?
faq.answer: The application ID (client ID) is returned when you create the app with Azure CLI or can be found in the Azure Portal under App registrations.
